page.title: 20Personal Recollections
page.content: Our second interview was with Mr.Cecil Frances.A Centenarian,he grew up in Chatteris,Cambs.and won a scholarship to Kirton Grammar School in 1898,at the age of 13.He had to go for lessons,on Saturdays,to a Pupil - Teacher, Jessop-son of the local Baker (still Jessops,now!)After lessons, their pocket money was spent on a pennyworth of stale buns,to be eaten later.Kirton,at that time,was'ever such a little place',whose only claim to fame was the Church of St.Peter and St.Paul,known as"the Cathedral of the Fens". Leaving school,he worked for Francis Kime,Ironmonger.When he was sacked (for cycling to Sleaford on a Saturday evening to visit a girl- friend,instead of working!)he went into farming in Frampton.He retired at 74.
